p: ICF estimates the user variability of medicinal plants and it is calculated as (N ur − N t)/(N ur − 1) (N ur: number of used citations in each ailment category, and Nt: number of medicinal plants reported in each ailment category). This index is used to indicate to what extent the information is homogenous. The ranges obtained for this factor vary between 0 and 1. A value close to 1 indicates a relatively high use of the medicinal plant, while a low value close to 0 shows that this plant species is not used by informants for the treatment of an ICF condition. This factor was originally developed by Trotter and Logan (1986) [ 25] and then readapted by Heinrich et al. 1998, 2000 [ 26, 27].
